result.execSummary:
The defendant Monique E Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 4 days time served with Huber for work, school, and child care.

miscConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Obtain and maintain employment. Obtain GED or HSED.
No contact with victim, or Montaya B.O.
Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction, provided probation is completed successfully.

Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Establish paternity for all her children.
Complete a parenting class.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on November 6, 2015.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Monique E Carter in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed. Court advised defendant that agent will schedule further review with the court if needed.

Defendant Monique E Carter in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Monique E Carter in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served with huber for work, school, and child care.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 3 months in the House of Correction with credit for zero days time served with huber for work, school, and child care.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 15 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, or Montaya B.O.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Establish paternity for all her children.
-Complete a parenting class.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Court finds the defendant eligible for expunction, provided probation is completed successfully.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

$750.00 on deposit to remain.  Defendant to post another $200.00.  All conditions remain.

Defendant Monique E Carter in court with attorney Alexis Stewart for Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Violation report from Justice point received and filed.  Defendant has tested positive for THC again.  Argument heard as to bail.  Court ordered cash bail set at $950.00.

Defendant Monique E Carter in court with attorney Alexis Stewart for Enku Edgar Lin.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

received and filed.  rmm

.
